isis.stitle: ALLISON WT TRANSMISSION ELECTRONIC CONTROLS - TROUBLESHOOTING - TROUBLESHOOTING WITH DIAGNOSTIC CODES

svcprocinfo.para: The tests in this section are written to be performed by reading the diagnostic codes using the shift selector and the Fluke 23 multimeter. In many cases a Pro-Link 9000 can be used for reading the codes and performing some system diagnostics if the proper Allison cartridge is available. Note that if battery power is not present at the VIM, the Pro-Link will not be able to read the codes or perform other diagnostics.

When beginning the troubleshooting process, always check for ACTIVE diagnostic codes first. The codes listed in this service section are only those codes that are likely to be involved with International-installed components and harnesses.For a full listing of diagnostic codes, refer to the Allison WT Service Manual.

important.para: Low transmission oil levels, low battery power, battery power interruptions and intermittent ground connections can cause many diagnostic codes to be registered.

step1.para: Perform TEST 1. Look carefully for (and correct) conditions that can cause intermittent conditions such as:

step2.para: Loose, dirty, corroded or painted connections.
Check the VIM for loose, incorrect or over-heating relays and fuses.

svcsubproc.title: Main Code 13 Sub Code 12 or 23 - ECU Input Voltage
svcsubproc.para: This code means the ECU has detected either a high or low battery input voltage. The ECU monitors battery voltage levels at the ignition feed circuit connection to the ECU (circuit 146 at B12), not the battery feed circuit. LOW voltage is considered less than 8 volts, and HIGH voltage is considered more than 32 volts. Common causes for this code are usually vehicle wiring conditions, vehicle charging system and batteries, or poor ground conditions.

note.para: The ECU turns OFF when voltage drops to approximately 6.5 volts.

step1.para: Perform TEST 1 and if determined by TEST 1, perform TEST 1A, 1B OR 1C.

svcsubproc.title: Main Code 21 Sub Code 12 or 23 - Throttle Position Sensor Fault Or Adjustment
svcsubproc.para: Main Code 21 Sub Code 12 indicates throttle position sensor failed LOW.
Main Code 21 Sub Code 23 indicates throttle position sensor failed HIGH.
This code indicates either the throttle position sensor has been pulled by its linkage into an error zone (HIGH or LOW), or a fault with the sensor or a fault with the wiring to the sensor.

note.para: Code 21 XX in combination with Code 33 XX indicates the loss of common ground wire, circuit 135 in transmission harness between the throttle and temperature sensors.

step1.para: Check the throttle position cable assembly for proper routing and connection to fuel pump arm ( Figure 5and Figure 6).Be sure there is no misalignment or obstruction to smooth movement of the throttle sensor cable assembly through the full stroke ( Figure 7 and Figure 8). There is no adjustment feature for this assembly at the pump arm.

figure.caption: Figure 7 - Throttle Position Sensor And Cable Installation
Figure 8 - Throttle Position Sensor Throttle Arm Connection

step1.para: Check throttle position sensor electrical connection to transmission harness for clean, tight connection, free of damaged wires, terminals etc.
If defects are not noted in Steps 1 or 2, have Allison dealer diagnose the TPS if fault code is still active.

svcsubproc.title: Main Code 22 Sub Codes 14, 15 and 16 - Speed Sensor/Circuit Fault
svcsubproc.para: This code indicates a fault with one of the speed sensors, or the wiring to one of the speed sensors.

step1.para: Check engine speed sensor connection at flywheel housing for clean, tight and undamaged connection.
Check output speed sensor connection at rear of transmission for clean, tight and undamaged connection.
If defects were not noted in Steps 1 or 2 and code is still active, have Allison dealer diagnose.

svcsubproc.title: Main Code 23 Sub Code 12, 13, 23, and 24
svcsubproc.para: This code indicates a fault with the shift selector assembly or the harnesses that connect it to the ECU and the VIM.

step1.para: Perform TEST 3 - TESTING SHIFT SELECTOR CIRCUITS.
If defects were not noted in Step 1, replace the shift selector.
If Steps 1 and 2 have been completed and defect is still present, have the Allison dealer diagnose.

svcsubproc.title: Main Code 35 Sub Code 00 - Power Interruption
svcsubproc.para: This code indicates that the ECU detected a complete battery power loss before the ignition was turned OFF. This code cannot be displayed as an active code, but will be displayed only after power is restored.

step1.para: Perform TEST 1 - CHECK BATTERY FEED/ IGNITION FEED AND GROUND CIRCUITS.
If defect is still present, have Allison dealer diagnose.
